intro: Astragalus pseudobabatagi, commonly known as the false babatagi milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in dry, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, hard pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Astragalus pseudobabatagi is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
